newsitem.title: UK: ICI sees pound hitting 1997 profit.
newsitem.headline: ICI sees pound hitting 1997 profit.

text.p: Britain's Imperial Chemicals Industries Plc said on Thursday the strong pound could reduce full-year profit by about 120 million stg if it remained at current levels.
ICI indicated during the the first quarter that it was looking at a full-year pound impact of about 80 to 90 million stg.
But the pound has gone up another five percent since then and the company is now looking at a larger number, finance director Alan Spall told Reuters.
"It is probably in the 120 million pound area if the current rates subsist for the rest of the year," he said in a telephone interview.
ICI earlier reported that pre-tax profit before exceptional items fell to 65 million stg from 202 million stg. The strong pound reduced first-quarter profit by 40 million stg.
